operator_interface.parts_variation_note: Parts type and number change in relation to machine configuration.
operator_interface.notice: The information regarding the programming and use of the control panel is given in the document INSTRUCTIONS B.

buttons.function: Pressed: it immediately STOPS the machine.
The flashing illumination indicates the detection of faults. Press for reset and alarms restoration. Blinking button goes off.
Flashing light signals button is active. Pressed with “AB-Key” button starts manual cycle. Button stays lit.
Pressed: allows machine timed STOPPAGE at the end of movements.
Pressed: sends request to unlock machine safety guard locks.

indicator_states.steady: Safety guard closed but not locked (lockable).

buttons.function: Selects blow molding machine operation in STAND ALONE or COMBO mode with filling machine. In COMBO mode, start-up and stoppage are controlled by buttons 12–13.
Enables operations with other button presses.

function_modes.operation_on: Pressed with button 3 starts selected manual cycle.
function_modes.operation_off_manual: Pressed with button 3 controls timed start-up of all blow molding machine axes.
function_modes.operation_off_ui: Pressed with start-up button on the operator interface screen, starts the previously selected area manually.

buttons.function: By approaching receiver, transponder key allows automatic login.
Allows filling machine stoppage at end of movements. In COMBO mode, stops automatic cycle for both filling and blow molding machines.
Starts machine functioning. In COMBO mode, starts automatic cycle for both machines.
Sends request to unlock safety guard locks.

indicator_states.steady: Safety guard closed but not locked (lockable).

mobile_control_device.description: Used for maintenance and/or size change-over at controlled and safe speed with safety guards open.
mobile_control_device.notice_1: Adjustments are not allowed on moving parts, even with the mobile control device.
mobile_control_device.activation: To activate, turn OPERATION selector switch to SET-UP.

positions: Fully released: operations are NOT allowed.
Fully pressed: panic emergency; requires a reset when engaged.

mobile_control_device.notice_2: Operates only if safety guard is open. Speed in jog mode cannot exceed 3% of max speed. Device location is in the LAYOUT document.

run.conditions: If safety and operating conditions are met
steps: Press RESET key on push-button panel to enable safety guards locking.
Press CYCLE START key on push-button panel to turn on the machine.

jog_mode.conditions: If safety and operating conditions are met
steps: Press RESET key to enable safety guards locking.
Press START key on mobile panel to turn on the machine.

stop: Wait until containers are out, then press CYCLE STOP key on push-button panel.

emergency_stop.description: Activated with special buttons or by fault messages causing shutdown.
emergency_stop.procedure: Deactivate emergency stop button OR identify and remove cause of activation of the safety device. Clear faults. Refer to INSTRUCTIONS B.

broken_bottle_container.caution: Use protective equipment when filling glass bottles/containers.
steps: Remove any residues of broken bottles/containers.
Clean machine base with a damp cloth and dry with compressed air.
Clean sensors, photocells, and reflectors delicately, ensuring no movement or damage.

cip_washing.description: Equipped with a CIP washing device for sanitizing parts in contact with filling liquid.

types_of_washing.description: Complete wash of plant using a washing product.
Fill machines with cleaning solution during inactivity after sanitizing.

sanitation.description: Sanitation involves washing, rinsing, and drainage for thorough cleaning.
sanitation.factors: Varies by product type, plant type, and environmental conditions.

cycles.description: After bottling problematic products such as milk-based.

step_1.hot_filling: Initial rinsing at filling temperature, gradually decrease to mains temperature.

steps_description.step_2: Cycle with soda (1.5%-2% at 80°-85°C) to permanently eliminate product residues.
steps_description.step_3: Rinse with mains temperature water until soda (or acid) is completely eliminated.
steps_description.step_4: Cycle with acid (nitric 1% at 30°C or phosphoric max 1% at 30°C) or with sanitizer (e.g., PAA-based).
steps_description.step_7: Final rinse with mains water until sanitizer/acid values reach customer specifications.

safety_instructions: Handle acids, soda, etc. with care during sanitation cycles.
In case of contact with sanitizing products, rinse thoroughly with water OR detergent substances provided.
Immediately consult a doctor if necessary.

cop_washing.description: The machine can have a COP washing system for external automatic wash.
cop_washing.reference: See the OPERATOR INTERFACE and INSTRUCTIONS B for controls.
